intro: Chromatotriccum scabrifolium, commonly known as the rough-leaved chromatic moss, is a species of moss belonging to the family Dicranaceae. It is characterized by its dark green, stiff, and rough-textured leaves that are often twisted or curled. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its reproductive structures, known as capsules, are borne on slender stalks and release spores when mature. Chromatotriccum scabrifolium plays a vital role in soil stabilization and nutrient cycling in its ecosystem.
